quotes.quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
Men think highly of those who rise rapidly in the world; whereas nothing rises quicker than dust, straw, and feathers.
You'll never rise any higher than the way you see yourself.
It is best to rise from life as from a banquet, neither thirsty nor drunken.
The way for a young man to rise is to improve himself in every way he can, never suspecting that anybody wishes to hinder him.
To rise from error to truth is rare and beautiful.
We rise in glory as we sink in pride.
We have to rise above bad fortune. We have to be in the good and enjoy the good, study and work and adventure and friendship and community and love.
'Rise' has a lot of different meanings. It's a call to action to rise from the dead and actually live.
No one rises to low expectations
Rise above oneself and grasp the world.
Rise with the hour for which you were made.
Rise up and be you. Your rise is your growth.
Rise up nimbly and go on your strange journey!
We rise with the lark and go to bed with the lamb.
Rise up and become the person you were meant to be.
Rise above the storm and you will find the sunshine.
We cannot rise higher than our thought of ourselves.
Rise free from care before the dawn, and seek adventures.
Rise in great might to fulfill your special specific mission.
No one rises so high as he who knows not whither he is going.
In order to rise from its own ashes, a Phoenix first must burn.
We rise to great heights by a winding staircase of small steps.
You learn to rise above a lot of bad things that happen in your life. And you have to keep going.
I rise to taste the dawn, and find that love alone will shine today.
Some rise by sin, and some by virtue fall.
It's a fine thing to rise above pride, but you must have pride in order to do so.
The rise or fall of Shanghai means the birth or death of the whole nation.
The rise of man from the animal to the human level was prolonged by the necessity of rising from a state of barbarism and violence to one of order and peace.
Always rise from the table with an appetite, and you will never sit down without one.
